NA1325.crop_desc: Narasimha (NA1325) is a non-Bt cotton variety that is well-suited for farmers in Telangana, especially those with black or red soils and good drainage. It's a reliable, medium-duration variety that gives stable yields, is naturally tolerant to some pests, and is a good choice for farmers who want to avoid genetically modified (Bt) cotton.
NA1325.cultivation_overview: Narasimha (NA1325) is a reliable, non-Bt cotton variety perfect for Telangana farmers. It's easy to grow, gives stable yields, and fits well in local conditions. The variety has good yield potential, superior fibre quality, and value as a parent line in breeding programs. It's also recognized as an elite variety that can be used by breeders to introduce desirable traits into other cotton lines.
unique_characteristics: Good for both rainfed and irrigated fields
Gives stable yields even in tough weather
Naturally tougher against some pests and diseases
Suitable for high-density planting to get more yield per acre
Good choice for farmers who want to avoid Bt cotton
NA1325.soil_type: Black or red soils with good drainage

NDLH1755.crop_desc: Shivanandi (NDLH-1755) is a non-Bt cotton variety developed to give farmers a reliable and high-yielding option for their fields. This variety is especially suitable for areas that depend on rainfall, as it can produce stable yields even when irrigation is limited. It is an improved American cotton (Gossypium hirsutum) developed for rainfed conditions in India.
NDLH1755.cultivation_overview: Shivanandi cotton gives good-quality fibre, which is important for getting better prices from traders and the textile industry. The plants grow uniformly and are healthy when you use certified seeds and follow proper spacing, making them easier to manage and harvest. The crop typically matures in about 150–180 days after sowing, with harvesting done in 3–4 rounds as bolls open.
unique_characteristics: Produces stable yields with limited irrigation
Good-quality fibre for better market prices
Natural tolerance to common pests and soil diseases
NDLH1755.soil_type: Suitable for various soil types with good drainage

storage_guidelines.picking: Harvest only dry, open bolls; avoid picking during or after rain
storage_guidelines.cleaning: Remove leaves, stems, and debris; keep different pickings separate
storage_guidelines.drying: Spread in thin layer in shade, ensure complete drying
storage_guidelines.storage_conditions: Clean, dry, well-ventilated rooms; use wooden pallets or tarpaulin
storage_guidelines.packing: Avoid tight compression; store loosely for air circulation
storage_guidelines.protection: Guard against pests, rodents, and dampness; use clean gunny bags

NDLH1938.crop_desc: Sri Rama (NDLH-1938) is a non-Bt American cotton (Gossypium hirsutum) variety developed by Acharya N.G. Ranga Agricultural University, Nandyal, and released in 2016. It is the result of a cross between NDLH-1797 and NDLH-1325. This variety matures in about 160 days and is suitable for both rainfed and irrigated conditions in southern and central India.
NDLH1938.cultivation_overview: Sri Rama is known for its medium plant height and spreading growth habit. It produces good quality fibre with a ginning outturn of around 33.4%, a fibre length of approximately 28 mm, and strong bundle strength, making it suitable for spinning and textile use. The average seed cotton yield is about 19.2 quintals per hectare under recommended management.
unique_characteristics: Medium plant height with spreading growth habit
Good for both rainfed and irrigated conditions
Average yield of 19.2 quintals per hectare
Moderate tolerance to pests and diseases
Natural weed suppression due to spreading habit

spacing.high_density: 80 x 20 cm or 90 x 15 cm or 60 x 30 cm

parentage.developer: Acharya N.G. Ranga Agricultural University, Nandyal

ADB542.crop_desc: Adilabad Kapas-1 (ADB-542) is a non-Bt cotton variety developed by the Agricultural Research Station in Adilabad, Telangana. It is particularly suited for rainfed conditions and is known for its compact plant type, large bolls, and resistance to major diseases and pests.
ADB542.cultivation_overview: This medium-duration variety takes 150-170 days to mature and produces large bolls weighing 4.1-6.0 grams each. It offers excellent fiber quality with a staple length of 27.3-32 mm and fiber strength of 20.6 g/tex, making it highly suitable for spinning and textile use.
unique_characteristics: Good fiber quality (27.3-32 mm staple length)
Disease resistant (bacterial leaf blight, tobacco streak virus)
ADB542.soil_type: Deep black soils with good drainage, also suitable for red loamy soils

spacing.high_density: 80 x 20 cm or 90 x 15 cm or 60 x 30 cm

WGCV48.crop_desc: WGCV-48 (Warangal Cotton Variety-48) is a non-Bt cotton variety developed for rainfed and irrigated conditions in Telangana. It is particularly known for its early maturity and high yield potential, making it a reliable choice for farmers seeking an early, high-yielding, non-Bt cotton option.
WGCV48.cultivation_overview: This variety stands out for its early square initiation (41 days), early flowering (66 days), and early boll bursting (93 days), which helps farmers harvest sooner and reduce risks from late-season pests or weather. It performs exceptionally well under high-density planting systems.
unique_characteristics: High number of bolls per plant (6-7)
Suitable for both rainfed and irrigated conditions
WGCV48.soil_type: Deep black soils and red loamy soils with good drainage
